definitions.text: the act of giving hope or support to someone

examples: they asked for a 10% rise in rates

definitions.text: the act of giving a push
examples: he gave her a boost over the fence
The landlord hiked up the rents

definitions.text: give a boost to; be beneficial to
examples: The tax cut will boost the economy

definitions.text: contribute to the progress or growth of
examples: I am promoting the use of computers in the classroom
boost the voltage in an electrical circuit

definitions.text: push or shove upward, as if from below or behind
examples: The singer had to be boosted onto the stage by a special contraption
